title: Read Classical Passages
instruction: Read these short passages from classical texts and translate the key phrase, demonstrating your understanding of the SOV structure.

questions.title: From a Refuge Prayer
questions.transliteration: bdag gis sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun la / byang chub bar du skyabs su mchi
questions.correctAnswer: I take refuge in the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha.
questions.analysis: Notice the SOV structure: བདག་གིས (I-by) is the subject, སངས་རྒྱས་ཆོས་དང་དགེ་འདུན་ལ (to Buddha, Dharma and Sangha) is the object with ལ particle, སྐྱབས་སུ་མཆི (go for refuge) is the verb phrase.

questions.title: From Bodhisattva Vows
questions.transliteration: sems can thams cad bde ba dang bde ba'i rgyu dang ldan par gyur cig
questions.questionPrompt: What is being wished for all sentient beings? Translate: སེམས་ཅན་ཐམས་ཅད་བདེ་བ་དང་བདེ་བའི་རྒྱུ་དང་ལྡན་པར་གྱུར་ཅིག
questions.correctAnswer: May all sentient beings be endowed with happiness and the causes of happiness.
questions.analysis: Subject: སེམས་ཅན་ཐམས་ཅད (all sentient beings), Object: བདེ་བ་དང་བདེ་བའི་རྒྱུ་དང (with happiness and causes of happiness), Verb: ལྡན་པར་གྱུར (become endowed)

correctFeedback: Excellent comprehension! You understand the classical text structure.
incorrectFeedback: Review the passage carefully. Pay attention to the case particles and verb placement.
